title: @Riot Anivia Q mechanic has changed?
body:
I main anivia and I just played her after the patch.
I thought the patch was just to show the radius of anivia's q explosion, but I was wrong.
before the patch, her q could be aimed outside the maximum distance and anivia would still fire the skill from where she was.
After the patch, if the cursor is outside the q distance range, anivia will fly the required distance before she can get the max distance.
For me, this is game breaking since I would always be aiming outside the maximum distance and be wondering why the skillshot hasn't been fired.

When you go in later to try and clean things up to make every run smoother or something like that some of those weird interactions rear their ugly heads.

The new Q indicator is an eyesore and more confusing than helpful. It hides minions and visibility on champions often and even though it shows the range of the stun, you're going to be aiming to hit a person dead center anyway most of the time unless you're trying to hit two people at once. Experience will teach that, some huge circle won't necessarily, especially since you won't be detonating the Q exactly where the indicator was in the first place making it not so useful as a real guide. It's easier to hit a skill being able to see it in flight and its path than a gaudy indicator. This is simply awful and I pray that they take the simple way of fixing the bug and just change the skill back to how it was. I've been missing a ton of Qs and I don't believe it's just because of the bug.
